page.title: 10SOCIAL CONCERNS-MERGER
page.content: Due to the growing population,the numbers of children at Great Paxton school have grown from 47 in 1978 to 87 in 1985.The buildings cannot cope with this continued growth. Already there are three temporary classrooms, with a fourth expected soon on the site,with the old buildings being used for the office,dining room and hall.Cambridgeshire County Council have decided that it would be best to close Great Paxton and Offord schools, and to build a new school on the site at Offord. Offord's school population is not growing in 1985 they have 90 puils ,but they do need a new school building The parents in Great Paxton objected to their children having to travel to Offord by bus and to losing their village school.
